name: Muslim Wellness Foundation
mission: Muslim Wellness Foundation (MWF) is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization dedicated to promoting healing and well-being in American Muslim communities through dialogue, education and training. The MWF approach to health is interdisciplinary, intergenerational, spiritually grounded, community based, and justice-oriented. From being the first Muslim organization in the country to offer Mental Health First Aid (MHFA) trainings to establishing the annual Black Muslim Psychology Conference (BMPC), MWF has been an outspoken leader in fostering visions for wellness and healing. Our programs demonstrate our keen awareness of the link between oppression, wellness and how communities heal, grow, thrive, and experience joy in the midst of it all. We will continue to lead the way in shifting the conversation on mental health, addiction and trauma - from one narrowly focused on stigma to a healing-centered model of collective well-being, faith, identity and belonging. Join us on this journey.
theoryOfChange: The MWF approach to health is interdisciplinary, intergenerational, spiritually grounded, community based, and justice-oriented, aiming to shift from stigma-focused models to healing-centered models of collective well-being.

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization addresses global health urgency by focusing on mental health, yet its alignment score of 29/50 reflects a low donor fit for those seeking large-scale or high-transparency operations [1][5]. As a sadaqah-eligible entity, it provides a niche pathway for general charitable giving within the American Muslim community [5].
dimension_explanations.impact: The foundation focuses on capacity building through Mental Health First Aid (MHFA) trainings and the Black Muslim Psychology Conference (BMPC) [3][4]. While it directs 100.0% of its spending toward these programs, the overall impact score of 27/50 is moderated by low data confidence and the lack of cost-per-beneficiary data [1][2].

strengths_deep_dive: Muslim Wellness Foundation distinguishes itself through a commitment to community-based healing that prioritizes marginalized voices within the faith. By focusing on <cite id="2">mental health literacy</cite>, the organization fills a critical gap in the American Muslim landscape. Their financial discipline is evidenced by <cite id="3">revenue growth from $99,778 in 2021 to $223,205 in 2023</cite>, all while maintaining a <cite id="5">100% program ratio</cite>. This growth suggests a strong community resonance with their <cite id="7">Mental Health First Aid trainings</cite> and advocacy work.
rich_narrative.summary: Muslim Wellness Foundation Inc (MWF) is a specialized nonprofit organization dedicated to <cite id="1">promoting healing and emotional well-being</cite> within the American Muslim community. Operating primarily as a capacity-building entity, the organization focuses on mental health literacy through <cite id="2">education and advocacy initiatives</cite>. Despite its relatively small scale, the foundation has demonstrated significant growth, reporting <cite id="3">total revenue of $223,205</cite> in the 2023 tax year, representing a <cite id="4">three-year revenue CAGR of 49.6%</cite>. A defining characteristic of MWF is its lean financial model; the organization maintains a <cite id="5">program expense ratio of 100.0%</cite>, ensuring that all functional expenses are directed toward its core mission. Key programming includes the <cite id="6">Black Muslim Psychology Conference (BMPC)</cite> and <cite id="7">Mental Health First Aid (MHFA) trainings</cite>, which address the intersection of faith, race, and psychological health. While the organization provides critical niche services, it operates with <cite id="8">limited liquidity of 0.2 months</cite> of working capital, suggesting a high reliance on consistent, immediate donor support to maintain its specialized community offerings.
